private_information: I am allowed to move only disks A B C D E F G H (A is smallest, H is 8th smallest).
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk moved at a time and no larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
I can place disks on any peg as long as rules are satisfied.
agent_1.goal: Cooperatively perform primitive moves to transform the initial configuration into the specified goal configuration.

private_information: I am allowed to move only disks I J K L M N O (I is 9th smallest, O is largest).
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk moved at a time and no larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
I can place disks on any peg as long as rules are satisfied.
agent_2.goal: Cooperatively perform primitive moves to transform the initial configuration into the specified goal configuration.

private_information: I coordinate the agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward planner.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' proposed move sequences, verify legality, and produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that encode the validated cooperative plan.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, right.
Initial configuration on left peg from top to bottom is A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O.
Middle peg is empty and right peg is empty initially.
Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A C D F G H I J K L M N O, middle peg top-to-bottom E, right peg top-to-bottom B.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Agents have disjoint move permissions: agent_1 may move A-H, agent_2 may move I-O.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You may move only disks A B C D E F G H. Provide a concrete ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform to contribute to the global goal. Each move must be one of: 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' where pegY and pegZ are one of left,middle,right. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions. Do not emit PDDL.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. You have the following private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves you are allowed to execute and ensure each move is legal under Tower of Hanoi rules.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You may move only disks I J K L M N O. Provide a concrete ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform to contribute to the global goal. Each move must be one of: 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' where pegY and pegZ are one of left,middle,right. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions. Do not emit PDDL.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. You have the following private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves you are allowed to execute and ensure each move is legal under Tower of Hanoi rules.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and an expert in PDDL for the FastDownward planner. You must integrate the move sequences from the two agents, verify that the combined move sequence is legal under Tower of Hanoi rules and agent permissions, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct in the PDDL (prefix action names or predicates to attribute moves to the correct agent).
pddl.prompt: You will receive two move lists: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and the agents' private information to validate and, if necessary, reorder or adjust moves so that the combined primitive sequence is legal and achieves the stated goal. Produce a PDDL domain and problem pair targeting the FastDownward planner that models the pegs, disks, disk sizes, legality constraints, and the allowed movers for each disk so that the validated cooperative plan is achievable. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
